page.title: 01WETHERBY (EAST) INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The area east of Wetherby forms part of the undulating Vale of York. Most of the area is underlain by Magnesian Limestone but there are extensive glacial deposits.
The western part of the area includes the main parts of Wetherby, the race course and the Youth Custody Centre. The remainder of the land is agricultural, with arable farming being dominant - especially the production of barley, wheat, oil seed rape and sugar beet.
Recently the landscape has changed as the increasing intensiveness of farming has resulted in the removal of many hedgerow and tree field boundaries thus causing a loss of habitat for many types of wildlife.
